diagnosis.primary: Classic Hodgkin Lymphoma (CHL), Mixed Cellularity type
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Pelvic pain, Fatigue, No B symptoms

treatmentPlan.modality: Combined Modality Therapy (Chemotherapy -> Ovarian Transposition -> Radiation)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV_ISRT_Pelvis encompassing initially involved nodal regions (Para-aortic, Bilateral Iliac)
treatmentPlan.priorSystemicChemo: ABVD x 4 cycles (Completed 06/15/2025) with Deauville Score 3 response

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in Vac-Lok bag with knee/foot positioning device. Full bladder protocol. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired supine for ISRT planning. Fused with diagnostic PET/CT. Ovarian transposition clips identified and contoured.

dosimetry.constraints: Bowel Max < 35 Gy; Ovary Dose minimized (< 5-10 Gy)
dosimetry.planNotes: Consolidation pelvic ISRT post-chemo/transposition. Fields designed to cover para-aortic and iliac chains while minimizing dose to transposed ovaries.

fractions.sideEffects: Mild fatigue. ~3 loose stools/day, managing with diet.

imagingAndReports.summary: Bulky para-aortic adenopathy, bilateral iliac adenopathy noted.
FDG-avid adenopathy corresponding to CT findings in para-aortic and iliac chains. No supradiaphragmatic or extranodal uptake. Deauville 5.
Resolution of bulky disease. Mild residual FDG uptake in prior para-aortic nodal sites, less than liver uptake (Deauville Score 3).
CT acquired supine in Vac-Lok for RT planning. Fused with diagnostic PET for target delineation.

progressNotes.author: Dr. James Peterson (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: 29yo F w/ biopsy-proven MC-CHL after presenting with pelvic pain. Staging PET confirms Stage IIA disease below diaphragm. Discussed treatment: Plan for 4 cycles ABVD followed by RT assessment. Discussed fertility preservation options; patient declined ovarian cryopreservation but interested in transposition if RT needed.

progressNotes.author: Dr. James Peterson (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Completed 4 cycles ABVD. Tolerated well. Post-chemo PET shows good partial response (Deauville 3). Recommend consolidation pelvic RT. Refer to Rad Onc and Gyn Onc for ovarian transposition consult.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Nancy Allen (Gyn Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient referred for ovarian transposition prior to pelvic RT. Discussed procedure, risks/benefits. Patient wishes to proceed. Scheduled for laparoscopic transposition.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Lisa Ray (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p ABVDx4 and ovarian transposition for Stage IIA infradiaphragmatic CHL, Deauville 3 response. Plan for adjuvant RT 30 Gy / 15 fx to involved sites (ISRT). Discussed Inverted Y field concept vs modern ISRT. Explained RT procedure, bowel/bladder prep, potential side effects (diarrhea, fatigue, bladder irritation, long-term fertility impact despite transposition). CT Sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Lisa Ray (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Completed 5/15 fx RT. Mild fatigue. ~3 loose stools/day, managing with diet. No urinary sx. Tolerating well. Setup verification images reviewed. Continue RT.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Curative-intent consolidation radiation therapy to treat the lymph node areas initially involved with Hodgkin Lymphoma.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute: Diarrhea, fatigue, bladder irritation (frequency/urgency), nausea, mild skin reaction. Late: Discussed long-term fertility impact and the goal of ovarian transposition to minimize this risk. Low risk of chronic bowel changes or secondary malignancy.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Following a low-residue diet if diarrhea occurs. Importance of hydration. Reporting uncontrolled diarrhea, significant bladder pain, or fever.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT, report side effects.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use anti-diarrheal or anti-nausea medications as needed.
